intro: Bupleurum saxatile, commonly known as the rock angelica, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to rocky and alpine regions of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, characterized by its aromatic foliage and umbellate inflorescences. The plant typically grows in dry, sunny habitats, often on limestone or sandstone soils. Its slender, branched stems bear small, greenish-white flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Bupleurum saxatile is valued for its medicinal properties and is sometimes used in traditional herbal medicine.
